data.title: Hungary: country data and statistics
data.meta_description: Hungary in numbers: demographics, economy, energy, climate and more data and comparisons with other countries.
data.text:
Geography

Hungary is a landlocked country east of the Alps. The land has a total area of 93,030 km² (35,919 mi²). This land area is approximately 89% of the area of Kentucky. Hungary is thus the 17th biggest country in Europe and in terms of area ranked 110th worldwide. A considerable share of the inhabitants (73%) belongs to the urban population. Almost every sixth inhabitant lives in Budapest.

Hungary is comparatively low at an average elevation of 143 meters above sea level. The highest mountain peak (Kékes) is at 1,014 meters. There is no access to the open sea. There are direct national borders with the seven neighboring countries Austria, Croatia, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia and Ukraine. The distance between New York City and the Capital Budapest is about 7,010 km (4,356 mi).
